snippet: The rape is the latest in a series of shocking assaults that have drawn attention to remote villages in India, where police precincts are far-flung and traditional forms of justice still dominate.
abstract: Thirteen-year-old girl from Swang Gulgulia Dhoura, India, is raped in what police say is punishment for her brother's alleged assault; attack is latest in series of shocking assaults that have drawn attention to remote Indian villages, where police precincts are far-flung and traditional forms of justice still dominate.
lead_paragraph: The rape is the latest in a series of shocking assaults that have drawn attention to remote villages in India, where police precincts are far-flung and traditional forms of justice still dominate.

headline.main: Indian Girl’s Rape Called Case of Eye-for-Eye Village Justice
headline.print_headline: Indian Girl’s Rape Called Case of Eye-for-Eye Village Justice
